intro: Hemandradenia mannii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant produces small, round, blue berries that contain the seeds. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Hemandradenia mannii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
